吊.definition: to suspend; to hang up; to hang a person

吊唁.definition: to offer condolences (for the deceased); to condole

吊審.definition: to bring to trial; to bring to court

吊帶.definition: suspenders; garters; shoulder strap; brace; sling

吊帶衫.definition: halter top; spaghetti strap top; sun top

吊打.definition: to hang sb up and beat him; (fig.) (slang) to own (one's opponent); to thoroughly dominate

吊斗.definition: (a container) carried suspended or underslung; cable car bucket

吊杆.definition: a boom (i.e. transverse beam for hanging objects)

吊樓.definition: house overhanging a river, supported at the rear by stilts; house built in a hilly area, supported by stilts

吊死.definition: death by hanging; to hang oneself

吊死鬼.definition: ghost of a person who died by hanging; hanged person; (coll.) inchworm; hangman (word game)

吊球.definition: to perform a drop shot (tennis etc); drop shot

吊瓶.definition: infusion bag or bottle (for an IV)

吊瓶族.definition: "infusion clan", patients who prefer medication by drip rather than orally or by injection etc

吊籃.definition: hanging basket (for flowers); gondola (of cable car)

吊胃口.definition: (coll.) to keep sb in suspense; to tantalize; to keep on tenterhooks

吊裝.definition: to construct by hoisting ready-built components into place

吊車尾.definition: (coll.) lowest-ranking (student, participant etc); to rank at the bottom of the list; to finish last

吊運.definition: to transport by crane; to convey

吊門.definition: an overhung door; a door that hinges upwards

吊頂.definition: suspended ceiling; false ceiling; to install a (decorative) suspended ceiling

吊鹽水.definition: (dialect) to put sb on an intravenous drip

吊點滴.definition: to put sb on an intravenous drip (Tw)
